original: Dhammapaccanīyānuloma (4), Tikatikapaṭṭhānapāḷi (5)🔽23.27. Dassanahetuttika, Kusalattika🔽Nadassanena pahātabbahetukaṁ nakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbahetuko kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Nadassanena pahātabbahetukaṁ naakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā dassanena pahātabbahetuko🔽akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā cha, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā🔽cha …pe… avigate nava.
analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma tika tika paṭṭhāna pāḷi  dassana hetu ttika kusala ttika  na dassanena pahātabba hetukam na kusalam dhammam paccayā na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukaḥ kusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi  na dassanena pahātabba hetukam na akusalam dhammam paccayā dassanena pahātabba hetuko  akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā cha ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā  cha pe a vigate nava
translated: The reverse order of the law of conditionality, The Paṭṭhāna text with the Tika commentary🔽The profitable triad with the cause that is to be abandoned by seeing, etc.

original: Nanevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbahetukaṁ naabyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nevadassanena🔽nabhāvanāya pahātabbahetuko abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā cha, adhipatiyā cha …pe… avigate cha.
analyzed: na neva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukam na abyākatam dhammam paṭicca na iva dassanena 🔽na bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā 🔽hetuyā cha adhipatiyā cha pe avigate cha
translated: With a profitable state that has a cause that is to be abandoned by seeing as its condition there arises a profitable state that has a cause that is neither to be abandoned by seeing nor by keeping in being.
